==Chinese==

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|气|t1=gas|川|t2=three|ls=ic}}. Also a {{liushu|psc|nocap=y}}, where {{zh-l|川}} acts as the phonetic component. Compare {{zh-l|*氘|deuterium}} and {{zh-l|*氚|tritium}}.

===Etymology===
From {{zh-l|川}} from the glyph, possibly influenced by {{cog|NL.|tritium}}. In Mandarin, it is pronounced in the first tone by analogy with {{zh-l|氕|protium}} and {{zh-l|氘|deuterium}}.
